articles.title: Never saw Sushant, Sara with heavy eyes: Kedarnath actor on rumours of drug use on set
articles.content: Sushant Singh Rajput and Sara Ali Khan's 'Kedarnath' co-star Nitish Bharadwaj, speaking to Times of India, addressed rumours of drugs consumption on set. "I [never saw] Sushant and Sara with heavy eyes or on a trip," he said. "Sushant used to smoke...cigarette but he was very agile-minded. Someone who does drugs isn't agile like him...That's what I think," Nitish added.
articles.author: Daisy Mowke

articles.title: Don't let NGOs collect funds in names of kids orphaned by COVID-19: SC to states
articles.content: The Supreme Court on Tuesday directed states and Union Territories to take action against all NGOs and persons indulging in illegal adoption of children orphaned due to COVID-19. It also directed the states and UTs to prevent NGOs from collecting funds in the names of such children by disclosing their identities and inviting people to adopt them.
articles.author: Sakshita Khosla

articles.title: Man who used racial slurs against Indians over COVID-19 on Twitter jailed in S'pore
articles.content: A 35-year old senior executive at a software company in Singapore has been jailed for three weeks after posting racially offensive tweets, including slurs to Indians and condemning Indian immigrants about COVID-19 last year. Zainal Bahari tweeted via account named 'sharonliew86'. Zainal's lawyer claimed he was taking over a "parody account" and "overstepped the mark" while trying to be funny.
articles.author: Arshiya Chopra

articles.title: Apple pays US woman millions after iPhone technicians post nude pics online
articles.content: Apple paid a "multimillion-dollar" settlement to a US woman after iPhone repair technicians uploaded her nude images and videos online and her attorney demanded $5-million compensation. She had sent her phone for repair in 2016 to Apple-approved repair contractor Pegatron Technology Service. Technicians then uploaded extremely personal material to the woman's Facebook account and other locations.
articles.author: Pragya Swastik

articles.title: Vaccinated woman seeks vaccinated groom in ad; 'New Normal?' asks Tharoor
articles.content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Tuesday shared a purported matrimonial advertisement of a woman vaccinated against COVID-19, seeking a groom who has also been vaccinated. Reacting to the ad, Tharoor said, "Vaccinated bride seeks vaccinated groom! No doubt the preferred marriage gift will be a booster shot!? Is this going to be our New Normal?"
articles.author: Sakshita Khosla

articles.title: Baba ka Dhaba owner resumes old eatery after restaurant fails, blames social worker
articles.content: Delhi's 'Baba ka Dhaba' owner Kanta Prasad said he closed the restaurant he opened last year after investing ₹5 lakh and has resumed his old eatery. He said the expenditure was ₹1 lakh/month but sales never crossed ₹40,000. He blamed social worker Tushant Adlakha, who he said helped him open the restaurant and manage investments but didn't give enough time.
articles.author: Apaar Sharma

articles.title: Ex-security guard poses as doctor and performs surgery in Pak; woman dies
articles.content: An 80-yr-old woman died after a former security guard at a hospital in Pakistan posed as a doctor and performed surgery on her. Muhammad Waheed Butt attempted to treat her back wound at a Lahore hospital. "We can't keep up with what every doctor and what everyone is doing at all times. It's a large hospital," a hospital official said.
articles.author: Ankush Verma

articles.title: Sold my bike due to financial strain amid pandemic: TV actor Nirbhay
articles.content: Television actor Nirbhay Wadhwa, who plays Lord Hanuman in show 'Vighnaharta Ganesh', spoke about the financial strain he faced amid the pandemic. He said, "There was rent to be paid, and the pandemic has been going on for months." "I sold one of my bikes, and I got money," he added. "There were...challenges because financial stability was impacted," Nirbhay said.
articles.author: Mahima Kharbanda

articles.title: She fought till the end: Sonu Sood on girl who died due to COVID-19
articles.content: Actor Sonu Sood recalled about a 25-year-old girl, who lost her life due to COVID-19, and said that he feels that he could've done more to save her. He added, "I got her airlifted from Nagpur to the Apollo Hospital in Hyderabad for a unique ECMO treatment. It wasn't easy for her but she fought till the very end."
articles.author: Mahima Kharbanda

articles.title: Pilots move Bombay HC, seek compensation after 13 COVID-19 deaths
articles.content: The Federation of Indian Pilots has approached the Bombay High Court seeking adequate compensation for pilots who died or are facing permanent disabilities due to COVID-19, priority in vaccination and insurance coverage. The pilots' body sought ex-gratia of ₹10 crore from the Centre for families of the deceased. As per the petition, 13 pilots succumbed to COVID-19 since February 2021.
articles.author: Kiran Khatri

articles.title: US' Washington allows shops to offer marijuana to people getting vaccines
articles.content: US' Washington has allowed licenced marijuana stores to offer free joints to promote on-site COVID-19 vaccine clinics, officials said on Monday. The "Joints for Jabs" programme allows shops to offer a single joint to anyone aged over 21 who gets vaccinated at an on-site clinic. The state already allows restaurants to offer free drinks in exchange for proof of vaccination.
articles.author: Medhaa Gupta

articles.title: Give jobs to families of staff who died of COVID-19: PMC asks depts
articles.content: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has asked all its departments to give jobs to the families of civic staffers who died of COVID-19. Seventy-one civic staffers have succumbed to the disease. "Most of them are from Class 3 and Class 4 category and it's necessary to provide financial support and income source to the affected family," the Additional Municipal Commissioner said.
articles.author: Deepika Bhatt

articles.title: Moderna seeks COVID-19 vaccine approval for teens in Europe, Canada
articles.content: US pharmaceutical company Moderna has said that it has asked the European Union (EU) and Canada to approve its COVID-19 vaccine for adolescents aged 12 to 17. Moderna said its coronavirus vaccine is "highly effective" for adolescents aged 12-17 and has no serious safety concerns. Last month, the EU had approved Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine for use in children aged 12-15.
articles.author: Athira Sasidharan

articles.title: Gautam Gambhir starts free COVID-19 vaccination camps in East Delhi
articles.content: BJP MP Gautam Gambhir on Tuesday started camps providing free COVID-19 vaccination to adults in Geeta Colony. The Member of Parliament from the East Delhi constituency had earlier informed that his foundation was tying up with some hospitals to provide free vaccination. An associate of Gambhir said similar camps will be started in areas like Mayur Vihar and Patparganj.
articles.author: Deepika Bhatt

articles.title: Our thinking can change after 10 years: Aakash on Robinson's suspension
articles.content: Talking about England pacer Ollie Robinson's suspension from international cricket over his nine-year-old racist and sexist tweets, commentator Aakash Chopra said that thinking can change after ten years. "We all make mistakes...we might disrespect someone [today] but ten years down the line, we might regret that. This can happen to all of us, let's be fair," he stated.
articles.author: Ankur Taliyan

articles.title: Apple's new encrypted browsing feature won't be available in China
articles.content: Apple on Monday introduced a new feature called "Private Relay" but said that it will not be available for its users in China due to regulatory reasons. The feature is designed to obscure a user's web browsing behaviour from internet service providers and advertisers. Users in China often use VPNs to get around the country's strict internet controls.
articles.author: Hiral Goyal

articles.title: Apple discusses EV battery supplies with Tesla supplier: Report
articles.content: Apple is in talks with Tesla-supplier CATL and BYD about the supply of batteries for its planned electric vehicle, Reuters reported citing sources. It has made building manufacturing facilities in the US a condition for potential battery suppliers. However, the discussions with both CATL and BYD are subject to change and it is not clear if agreements will be reached.
articles.author: Aishwarya Awasthi

articles.title: Delhi CM urges PM Modi to allow implementation of ration scheme
articles.content: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday requested PM Narendra Modi "with folded hands" to allow the implementation of doorstep ration delivery scheme. "Till date, I have supported you in all the work of national interest. You should also support us for the same. The scheme should be implemented in the whole country during the...[COVID-19 pandemic]," Kejriwal wrote to PM Modi.
articles.author: Shreyasi Banerjee

articles.title: 2 civil defence volunteers held for robbery in Delhi
articles.content: Two civil defence volunteers were arrested for allegedly robbing a man in Delhi's Narela area, police said. "The accused slapped the victim and took his cell phone before escaping," said DCP (Outer North). "Both were later arrested by police and the stolen cell phone and the motorbike used by the accused were recovered," he added.
articles.author: Subhasish Dutta

articles.title: Hope vaccination process will be quickened after meeting with PM: Tope
articles.content: A delegation of the Maharashtra government met Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday (today), said Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope. "We hope that the vaccination process will be further quickened after today's meeting with PM Modi," he added. Eight to ten issues including Maratha reservation were discussed in the meeting with the PM, Tope stated.
articles.author: Sakshi Sharma

articles.title: Hyd Mayor holds review meet on Strategic Nala Development Programme
articles.content: Hyderabad's Mayor Vijayalaxmi Gadwal on Monday held a review meeting on Strategic Nala Development Programme (SNDP) and ongoing nalas cleaning work within the GHMC limits. The meeting was attended by Deputy Mayor Mothe Srilatha Shoban Reddy, GHMC Commissioner Lokesh Kumar DS and other officials. The review meeting took place days after a seven-year-old died by falling into an open drain.
articles.author: Bulbul Sharma

articles.title: Telangana cabinet to meet today to decide COVID-19 curbs extension
articles.content: The Telangana state cabinet chaired by Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao is scheduled to meet on Tuesday to assess the COVID-19 situation and take a decision regarding the ongoing lockdown in the state. The state government extended the ongoing COVID-19 curbs on May 31. The curbs were further extended for 10 days to contain the spread of the virus.
articles.author: Ravi Dutta Mishra

articles.title: US federal agents to wear body cameras when serving warrants
articles.content: The US federal agents will be required to wear body cameras when serving search and arrest warrants, the Department of Justice (DoJ) said. Agents from the FBI, the US Marshals Service, the DEA and the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives will be required to wear the cameras. The new directive was announced by Deputy Attorney General Lisa Monaco.
articles.author: Subhasish Dutta

articles.title: Russia imposes sanctions on Canadian officials in tit-for-tat move
articles.content: Russia has imposed sanctions on nine senior Canadian officials, including Justice Minister David Lametti. The officials have been banned from entering Russia indefinitely, Foreign Ministry said. The move came in retaliation after Canada sanctioned nine Russian officials in March over the treatment of Kremlin critic Alexey Navalny. Canada's Foreign Ministry said the sanctions were "unacceptable".
articles.author: Athira Sasidharan

articles.title: Bank of India shares fall by 3% after RBI imposes ₹4 crore penalty
articles.content: Shares of Bank of India fell by 3.13% to trade at ₹82 as of 3:10 pm on Tuesday after the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) imposed a penalty of ₹4 crore. The bank was fined for non-compliance of know your customer and money laundering guidelines. Recently, the bank reported a net profit of ₹250.19 crore in January-March quarter.
articles.author: Krishna Raj

articles.title: Delhi records over 500 new COVID-19 cases, 50 deaths; positivity rate at 0.68%
articles.content: Delhi on Friday registered a slight uptick in the daily COVID-19 cases with 523 new infections in the last 24 hours, as compared to 487 infections reported on Thursday. The daily positivity rate in Delhi on Friday was 0.68% as compared to 0.61% on Thursday. As many as 50 more COVID-19 related deaths were reported in Delhi on Friday.
articles.author: Sakshita Khosla

articles.title: Yami Gautam gets married to 'Uri' director Aditya Dhar, shares pic
articles.content: Actress Yami Gautam took to social media on Friday to reveal that she got married to 'Uri: The Surgical Strike' director Aditya Dhar. "With the blessings of our family, we have tied the knot in an intimate wedding ceremony today," she wrote. "Being very private people, we celebrated this joyous occasion with our immediate family," Yami added.
articles.author: Daisy Mowke

articles.title: Indian-origin photographer's optical illusion pic of orangutan wins ₹1.5L cash prize
articles.content: Thomas Vijayan won Nature TTL Photographer of the Year 2021. Vijayan, hailing from Kerala and now settled in Canada, shot the picture titled 'The World is Going Upside Down', in Borneo. "I selected a tree that was in water...The water formed a mirror...Then I climbed...the tree and waited for hours," said Vijayan, who got £1,500 (₹1.5 lakh) cash prize.
articles.author: Daisy Mowke

articles.title: Gautam Gambhir to organise 1-month free COVID-19 vaccination camps
articles.content: BJP MP Gautam Gambhir has said that his foundation will organise a month long free COVID-19 vaccination camps. Taking to Twitter, Gambhir wrote, "Delhi doesn't need blame game, it needs intent." This comes a day after the Delhi High Court was told by the drug controller that Gambhir's foundation had unauthorisedly procured high quantity of Fabiflu for distribution.
articles.author: Ridham Gambhir

articles.title: 9-yr-old lioness dies of suspected coronavirus infection in Chennai; 8 lions infected
articles.content: A nine-year-old lioness, Neela, has died in Chennai's Arignar Anna Zoological Park, days after testing positive for coronavirus with eight other lions. "The lioness had been asymptomatic and showed some nasal discharge only the day before," the zoo said. The zoo authorities said they have sent the samples again for testing to rule out possibility of a false positive report.
articles.author: Arshiya Chopra

articles.title: Ensure parental property of kids orphaned by COVID isn't sold: Govt to states
articles.content: The Ministry of Women and Child Development has written to state governments mentioning guidelines to handle children orphaned by COVID-19. The letter states that the children shouldn't be exploited financially which includes that their ancestral property isn't sold. Among other norms, it also mentions that the grants received by child should only be used for his/her education and welfare.
articles.author: Ridham Gambhir

articles.title: Govt releases state-wise distribution of COVID-19 cases in India
articles.content: The government on Friday released state-wise distribution of COVID-19 cases in India, naming 12 states/UTs that have 1 lakh or less confirmed coronavirus cases. There are 13 states/UTs, including Odisha, Telangana and Uttarakhand, that have confirmed cases between 1 lakh and 8 lakh. Meanwhile, 11 states/UTs like Maharashtra, Uttar Pradesh and Delhi have more than 8 lakh total coronavirus cases.
articles.author: Arshiya Chopra

articles.title: India overtook US in terms of number of people who got at least 1 vaccine dose: Govt
articles.content: India has overtaken the US in terms of the number of people who have received at least one dose of the COVID-19 vaccine, NITI Aayog member Dr VK Paul said on Friday. As of Thursday (June 3), India administered 17.2 crore vaccine doses as compared to 16.9 crore doses administered in US and 3.9 crore doses in UK, he said.
articles.author: Sakshita Khosla

articles.title: Russian player arrested at French Open amid match-fixing investigation
articles.content: Russian tennis player Yana Sizikova has reportedly been arrested at the French Open amid allegations of match-fixing in last year's tournament. An investigation was reportedly opened last October after Sizikova and her partner Madison Brengle were defeated in the first round of women's doubles in the tournament. Sizikova also lost in the first round of women's doubles this year.
articles.author: Ankur Taliyan

articles.title: HDFC Bank retracts crypto warning after RBI says its 2018 circular is not valid
articles.content: HDFC Bank retracted an email sent to customers late last week, which warned them about dealing in cryptocurrency transactions citing a 2018 order from RBI that was struck down by the Supreme Court last year. This comes after RBI issued a clarification on May 31 that its 2018 order was not valid and can't be cited.
articles.author: Arshiya Chopra

articles.title: Govt clears ₹43,000 cr project to build 6 high-tech submarines in India
articles.content: The Ministry of Defence on Friday said it has cleared a project to domestically build six conventional submarines equipped with state-of-the-art technology at a cost of around ₹43,000 crore. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said the project's approval by the Defence Acquisition Council (DAC) was a "landmark approval", adding, "This would be one of the largest 'Make in India' projects".
articles.author: Sakshita Khosla

articles.title: Salary, pension can be credited via NACH even on bank holidays from Aug 1: RBI policy
articles.content: The RBI has announced that the National Automated Clearing House (NACH), a bulk payment system operated by NPCI, will be available on all days of the week from August 1. This means that a bank holiday will no longer stop transfer of dividend, interest, salary and pension and collection of payments related to electricity, telephone and periodic instalments towards loans.
articles.author: Kiran Khatri

articles.title: Quit films because of ex-husband's conservative family: Pooja Bedi
articles.content: Pooja Bedi, during a conversation with Samir Soni, opened up about her exit from Bollywood. She said, "My ex-husband (Farhan Furniturewalla) told me, if I was going to get married, I couldn't continue in films because his family is very conservative." Pooja added, "So, to me, it was like, 'Okay, I'll give up this journey...and start a new one'."
articles.author: Udit Gupta

articles.title: Siddharth Pithani sent to 14-day judicial custody in drugs case
articles.content: Late actor Sushant Singh Rajput's ex-flatmate Siddharth Pithani, who was recently arrested by the Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB), has been sent to 14-day judicial custody. He was arrested from Hyderabad in connection with the drugs case linked to Sushant's death. The agency has recently interrogated Neeraj and Keshav, the former domestic workers of the late actor.
articles.author: Udit Gupta

articles.title: Australia detects coronavirus variant first found in India
articles.content: Australia said it has detected the Delta variant of COVID-19 that was discovered in India for the first time in the outbreak in Melbourne. The Delta variant was detected in two members of a family. "The fact that it's a variant different to other cases it means it's not related, in terms of transmission, with these cases," an official said.
articles.author: Shailesh

articles.title: No active COVID-19 case in Pimpri-Chinchwad's Roseland: Society Chairman
articles.content: The Chairman of Roseland Housing Society, one of the largest societies in Pimpri-Chinchwad said that they don't have a single active COVID-19 case. In early May, there were 74 cases in the society. "An eight-bed isolation ward was readied...We had set up a testing camp," said Chairman Santosh Maskar, adding that a COVID-19 protection team was also set up.
articles.author: Navashree Nandini

articles.title: B'luru triage centres can now book hospital beds for COVID-19 patients
articles.content: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) upgraded its portal where hospital beds can be allotted for patients walking into Physical Triaging Centres in Bengaluru. A total of 26 hospitals are mapped across all zones for beds. "BBMP plans to move towards mandatory physical triaging as a prerequisite for all patients seeking hospital admissions," a statement read.
articles.author: Christina George

articles.title: Antivirus software Norton 360 lets users mine Ethereum
articles.content: Some Norton 360 users have been given access to a new feature, Norton Crypto, which will allow them to mine Ethereum cryptocurrency. NortonLifeLock plans to expand the feature to all of its Norton 360 customers in the coming months. Customers will be able to track and transfer their earnings into a wallet.
articles.author: Aishwarya Awasthi

articles.title: Priyanka Vadra to bear my education expenses: Bihar's 'cycle girl'
articles.content: Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Friday spoke to Bihar's 'cycle girl' Jyoti Kumari, who cycled 1,200 km from Gurugram to Bihar, and said that she would bear her education expenses. Priyanka Gandhi also expressed condolences on her father's demise. "Priyanka didi told me not to worry...I also told didi that I want to meet her," Jyoti Kumari said.
articles.author: Navashree Nandini

articles.title: Govt must ensure 1cr COVID-19 vaccinations per day: Goa Cong to Prez
articles.content: The Goa unit of Congress submitted a memorandum to President Ram Nath Kovind asking him to direct the Centre to ensure one crore COVID-19 vaccinations per day. The delegation led by Goa Pradesh Congress Committee chief Girish Chodankar submitted the memorandum through the Governor of Goa, BS Koshyari. "Vaccination is the only protection in...COVID-19 pandemic," the party wrote.
articles.author: Navashree Nandini

articles.title: Andhra CM's sister registers her party as 'YSR T'gana Party': Reports
articles.content: Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy's sister YS Sharmila registered her political party as 'YSR Telangana Party' on Thursday, as per reports. This comes months after Sharmila announced that she would officially launch her party on July 8. As per the reports, an application was submitted to the Election Commission of India to register her party.
articles.author: Navashree Nandini

articles.title: 2 minors booked for raping classmate in car after offering her ride
articles.content: Two minors have been booked for allegedly raping and assaulting their 17-year-old classmate in a car in Punjab, police said. The girl purportedly told her mother that she, along with her friend, was offered a ride by the accused. Her friend was eventually asked to get off. Later, the accused allegedly stopped the car and one of them raped her.
articles.author: Shreyasi Banerjee

articles.title: Birth rate in Japan falls to all-time low, marriages also decline
articles.content: The number of babies born in 2020 in Japan hit a record low amid coronavirus pandemic, Health Ministry said. The number of births fell to 840,832 in 2020, down 2.8% from 2019 and the lowest since records began in 1899. The number of marriages fell 12.3% last year to 525,490, lowest since the end of World War II, it added.
articles.author: Athira Sasidharan

articles.title: France suspends joint military operations with Mali over coup
articles.content: France said it'll suspend joint military operations with Mali in response to the West African country's second coup in nine months, "awaiting guarantees" that civilian rule will return. Colonel Assimi Goïta had seized power after detaining interim President Bah Ndaw last week. Earlier, the African Union and the Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS) had suspended Mali's membership.
articles.author: Shailesh
